channel.title: Dwarf Remains Issue - IMPORTANT Please Read!
channel.description:
Hello everyone, Fox0wnage here again with another interesting question. Now I've posted some ridiculous topics containing some equally ridiculous questions. But I've never seen anything like this. First off allow me to state that my server is a DeltaScape base.
Okay, so here's my problem: When ever I sell a NOTED item to a shop, it appears in the shop as 'Dwarf Remains'. How can I prevent this? If you need me to post any code in which you may need to see, please give me the details of what you want, and I can provide you with the material to help me.
Thanks!

item.title: Dwarf Remains Issue - IMPORTANT Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @Usagi Usagi
item.description:
@Usagi wrote:

[font=courier]Replace: [code=java] public int GetUnnotedItem(int ItemID) {
int NewID = 0;
String NotedName = “”;

	for (int i = 0; i < server.itemHandler.MaxListedItems; i++) {
		if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i] != null) {
			if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemId == ItemID) {
				NotedName = server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemName;
			}
		}
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < server.itemHandler.MaxListedItems; i++) {
		if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i] != null) {
			if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemName == NotedName) {
				if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemDescription
						.startsWith("Swap this note at any bank for a") == false) {
					NewID = server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemId;
					break;
				}
			}
		}
	}
	return NewID;
}[/code]

[font=courier] with: [code=java] public int GetUnnotedItem(int ItemID) {
int NewID = 0;
String NotedName = “”;

	for (int i = 0; i < server.itemHandler.MaxListedItems; i++) {
		if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i] != null) {
			if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemId == ItemID) {
				NotedName = server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemName;
			}
		}
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < server.itemHandler.MaxListedItems; i++) {
		if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i] != null) {
			if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemName == NotedName) {
													i = i - 1; // Takes 1 from i (item found in list) which makes the next statement successful.
				if (server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemDescription
						.startsWith("Swap this note at any bank for a") == false) {
					NewID = server.itemHandler.ItemList[i].itemId;
					break;
				}
			}
		}
	}
	return NewID;
}[/code]

[font=courier] I am very positive that this can be bugged up EASILY. Basically after debugging that function it kinda skips the first thing, and then checks to see if its the noted one and goes fuck no (excuse my french mate) and cannot find it so it returns null or 0 so you get dwarf remains which has the itemID of 0. What I added was i = i-1 so before the next if statement the itemID is one less then the one which matches up. This makes the next if statement valid and it will give you the noted item unnoted (in shops w/e).

Although I am looking for a better way to do this method, I am thinking a ‘while’ but it will cause some severe lag and will prolly end up crashing and be useless. Hope alot of people use this code because I have not seen a fix for it either.[/font]

Read full topic
item.source: Dwarf Remains Issue - IMPORTANT Please Read!
